results.title: I am a country
results.creator_credit: Herb Taylor, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Provides a showcase for products manufactured in Canada, including heavy duty machinery for Canadian conditions, aircraft designed for special duties, women’s fashions and other items, all bearing the “Made In Canada” label.

results.title: Hymn
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A pleasing action portrait of Montreal and the Quebec scene. Students experiment with techniques - the zoom and accelerated motion and find no scarcity of subjects. It is a visual hymn with a lift, a vital frantic response to the charms of the old province.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Hydrocarbons and their structure
results.brief_description: Laboratory demonstration, animation, and structural and scale models are used to explain the five homologous series of hydrocarbons and to show how members of each series differ from the others.

results.title: Hydro-electric power
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Describes the way in which moisture laden cloud becomes rain, and eventually a flowing river with perhaps a waterfall included in its course. The principles of hydro-electric power are explained and model maps are used to show a plan of the Snowy Mountains undertaking.

results.title: The Hydra
results.creator_credit: Percy Smith, Julian Huxley and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The first part of this film studies the natural surroundings of the hydra, and the structure of the organism and the second part focuses on the process of regeneration after bisection, the manner in which food is caught and digested, sexual reproduction by eggs and sperm, and a sexual reproduction by budding.

results.title: Hush little baby
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Picture Book Parade”.
Family life in 18th century America is pictured with authenticity and charm in this enchanting animated rendition of the traditional folk lullaby. Illustrated and based on the book by Aliki.

results.title: Hurricane circuit
results.brief_description: Shows how the warning centre at Miami, Florida, reduces hurrican menace in the Caribbean and the Gulf of Mexico. The operation of the warning system, precautions against damage, rescue and relief measures, and international aspects of the warning system. The nature of hurricanes is shown by animation.

results.title: The Hurdles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Track and Field Instruction”.
Hurdling explained and demonstrated, aided by stop action and slow motion sequences. Includes training exercises for athletes and training procedure for both high and low hurdling being practised under the direction of a coach.

results.title: Huon's new harvest
results.brief_description: The construction of a wood pulping factory in southern Tasmania. How the great eucalypt forests are managed, huge logs converted to pulp pellets, and then these pellets are shipped to Sydney where strong packaging paper is manufactured for supply to fibreboard container manufacturers.
results.description: The construction of a wood pulping factory in southern Tasmania. results.title: Hunters of the North Pole
results.creator_credit: Nils Rasmussen, Donald Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A glimpse of life as far north as it can be lived, with scenes of walrus, seal and polar-bear hunts. Taking us northward to Greenland, the camera records the year’s round for the Inuit of Thule. In the lengthening daylight of spring, they cross the sea ice by dog sled in quest of seal and polar bear, racing towards land with their catch as the ice bridge begins to melt and crack. When the autumn days shorten, the hunters, in final preparation for the months of Arctic night, set out in boats to harpoon walrus.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nils Rasmussen, Donald Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
